title: Hubert Jocham releases Konsens
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080316192733/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 4.Mar.2008 8.27am 

Germany has a strong heritage of industrial typefaces constructed by engineers utilizing square and circles. DIN Mittelschrift is one very famous example.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080316192733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gConstruct_5211.jpg)

Since the »Romain du Roi« we know that it is tricky to draw a geometrical typeface. For optical reasons you have to go away from circles and lines with exactly one weight. Therefore the aim was not to construct a typeface but to draw it in a way that appears constructed. As you can see in the picture, the final typeface is very different.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080316192733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WasserKonsens_5229.jpg)

The design of a typeface is like stage production. Like strongly made up actors, the characters of a typeface must be super-elevated, to be very clear in there role. Particularly in small sizes.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080316192733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KonFetten_3867.jpg)

Konsens has 9 weights from Light to Ultrabold with italics like most of my other families. In addition to that there a Stencil headline companion. It also has got 9 weights but no italics.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080316192733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WasserKonsensSten2_5661.jpg)
